availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John S. C. Gregory (Wayne County, Kentucky, farm laborer)

body.p: Wayne County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Fleming Gregory and Caroline Gregory. Resident of Wayne County in 1850. Farm laborer in Wayne County in 1860. Served in the 30th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as a private from April 5, 1864 to April 18, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne County, Division 2, p. 241B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne County, p. 279.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne County, District 5, p. 90B.
Find A Grave, "John S. Cullom Gregory (1843-1934)," Memorial #6049991, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/6049991 (accessed June 17, 2020).
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0399.
